item.title: Use applications with intention
item.description: A long time ago, we couldn’t reach the information we want. While that’s no longer the case, today, we struggle with different problems: noise, clutter, and discovery. We receive so many emails throughout the day, many of which are just junk. Despite finding relevant and high-quality content is a significant problem, applications train their discovery algorithms toward a different purpose: for us to use them much longer than what is necessary.

item.title: Planning vs Preparation
item.description: You do planning to design the set of actions to achieve a goal. You do preparation to get ready for some future goal. Both are important. But the famous quote goes: “Everybody has a plan until they get punched in the mouth.” If your plans need to change during execution, the number of required modifications, and how well you carry out those modifications depend on your preparation.
